item.name: Benchmarks
Get a list of benchmark bundles

request.description: Get a list of benchmark bundles that you have access to

item.name: Get a list of benchmark bundles details

request.description: Returns the questions and details included in a given bundle
Returns the benchmark for the given bundle

item.description: Benchmark data comes from SurveyMonkey customers who used Question Bank questions in their surveys. Organizations of all shapes and sizes use Question Bank, like local coffee shops, schools, and Fortune 500 companies. Benchmarks give context to your survey results by allowing you to compare your results to others who used the same Question Bank questions as you.

item.description:
Collectors allow you to collect survey responses with a link to your survey. There are two types of collectors available via the API, weblink and email. Weblink collectors collectors give you a survey URL and email collectors can be used to send survey invites messages that include a survey URL via the /messages endpoints. A variety of collector options are accepted as arguments to /surveys/{id}/collectors. Some collector options, for example, is_branding_enabled=False require a SurveyMonkey paid plan.

The View Collectors and Create/Modify Collectors scopes are both available Basic (Free) plans, however you will need to upgrade to a paid plan to view more than 100 responses or to use the survey responses endpoints.

NOTE: Contacts can also be created if they are passed directly to /collectors/{id}/messages/{id}/recipients.

item.description:
These endpoints let you create responses directly via the API and view responses you have collected through any collector type.

Scopes to use these endpoints require a paid plan.The view responses scope requires A GOLD plan and the Create/Modify responses scope requires ENTERPRISE/PLATINUM plan.

item.name: Surveys, Pages, and Questions

request.description: Return a list of surveys owned or shared with the authenticated user
Create a new empty survey, if a template id or an existing survey id is specified, a survey prepopulated with pages and questions
Returns a survey's details. To get an expanded version showing all pages and questions use /surveys/{survey_id}/details

Modifies a survey’s title or language

Delete a survey

Get a list of survey templates. Survey template ids can be used as an argument to POST a new survey
Get a list of survey pages
Create a new empty page
Get a page's details
Modify a page
Replace a page
Delete a page
Get a list of questions on a survey page
Create a new question on a survey page
Get a question's details
Updates a question
Replace a question
Delete a question

item.description:
The following endpoints let you create surveys, survey pages, and add questions to survey pages. They require the View Surveys and Create/Modify surveys scopes, both available to a Basic (Free) plans. Creating a survey with more than 10 questions requires a paid plan.

A POST to /surveys will create an empty survey to which you can add pages and questions (See formatting question types). This endpoint also accepts a survey or template ID as an arguement to create a pre-populated survey that can be used as is or modified by deleting, updating, or adding pages or questions.

A survey needs at least one page and question in order to record a survey response.

item.name: Users and Groups

request.description: Returns the current user's account details including their plan
Return a group if the user account belongs to a group (users can only belong to one group)
Returns a group’s details including the group’s owner and email address
Returns a list of users who have been added as members of the specified group
Return a group memeber's details including their role and status

item.description: Use these endpoints to get user’s account information, any groups a user belongs to, and the account information for the group’s owner and other members including their roles and whether or not they have accepted an invite into the group (are active).

item.name: Webhooks

request.description: Get a list of webhooks
Create a webhook
Get a webhook by id
Modify a webhook
Replace a webhook
Delete a webhook

item.description:
Create webhooks that subscribe to various events in SurveyMonkey. You can create a webhook to callback when:

A survey response is completed (‘response_completed’)
A survey response is disqualified ('response_disqualified’)
A survey response is updated ('response_updated’)
A new collector is created for a survey ('collector_created’)
A survey’s collector is updated ('collector_updated’)
A survey’s collector is deleted ('collector_deleted’)

You can specify one or more survey or collector ids to be included. The view webhooks and create/modify webhooks scopes are available on a Basic(Free) SurveyMonkey plan.
